name: Whorled Watermilfoil

Identifying Characteristics: Leaves: two types: submersed – finely feather divided, 5-14 leaflet pairs, whorls of 4-5 leaves, internodal space up to 1cm; emergent (bracts) – pinnately lobed, arranged in whorls, two or more times longer than flowers
Flowers: midsummer, very small occurring on emergent spike (4-15cm)
Fruits/Seeds: small, splits into 4 chambers with 1 seed per chamber
Habitat: Prefers quiet waters of lakes and streams
Range: Maine, New England, much of United States

tags: plants with finely-divided leaves on stems
